channel.title: Basic html
channel.description:
[size=20pt]Getting Started with HTML![/size] What is HTML? * HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language * An HTML file is a text file containing small markup tags * The markup tags tell the Web browser how to display the page * An HTML file must have an htm or html file extension * An HTML file can be created using a simple text editor Basic HTML Layout Title of page This is my first homepage. This text is bold [color=black]html codes: *[color=purple]Images; *[color=red]Changing font; *[color=blue]Headers!

This is a heading

This is a heading

This is a heading

This is a heading

This is a heading
This is a heading
*[color=maroon]Paragraphs

This is a paragraph

This is another paragraph

*[color=green]Comments -HTML *[color=orange] Links! Ok here is how links work in HTML. TEXTHERE Put the link between the first quotes and the text to be displayed after the > which it says TEXTHERE Now if you want an image to be placed instead of text use this if u hav anythin else i should put on this post pls post here.......

item.title: Basic html
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“killa, post:5, topic:58399”]change back ground color in the

<body>

add bgcolor=“and yur color”
so

[code]

[/code][/quote]

No.

Tree:

It’s hilarious to see countless people post ‘basic’ tutorials most likely due to the fact you can’t write anything more advanced yourself.

So true.

Read full topic

item.description:

[/quote]

try and use hex it will get you a better colour i remember reading it some ware that green and blue ect can vary from pc to pc so if you use hex its allways the same[/quote]i lold

item.title: Basic html
item.dc:creator: @Cabby Cabby
item.description:
@Cabby wrote:

Touch it up a bit… Put the codes in

[code][/code]

It gives your post some style I know how you did it the color way, but it would look better in the code tags. Also It might just be me, but the codes all blend in with what you say your describing.

Read full topic

item.title: Basic html
item.dc:creator: @saadra saadra
item.description:
@saadra wrote:

[size=20pt]Getting Started with HTML![/size]

What is HTML?

 * HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language
  * An HTML file is a text file containing small markup tags
  * The markup tags tell the Web browser how to display the page
  * An HTML file must have an htm or html file extension
  * An HTML file can be created using a simple text editor

Basic HTML Layout

Title of page This is my first homepage. This text is bold

[color=black]html codes:

*[color=purple]Images;

*[color=red]Changing font;

*[color=blue]Headers!

This is a heading

This is a heading

This is a heading

This is a heading

This is a heading
This is a heading

*[color=maroon]Paragraphs

This is a paragraph

This is another paragraph

*[color=green]Comments -HTML

*[color=orange] Links!

Ok here is how links work in HTML.

TEXTHERE

Put the link between the first quotes and the text to be displayed after the > which it says TEXTHERE

Now if you want an image to be placed instead of text use this

if u hav anythin else i should put on this post pls post here…

Read full topic
